cluster_relations.rel_desc: Use of color in branding and design is described as playing a crucial role in overall branding and marketing strategies.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject element plays a functional or causal role in achieving, shaping, or supporting the object branding outcome or strategy.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Color use in branding and design contributes to creating a brandâ€™s visual identity.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject element plays a functional or causal role in achieving, shaping, or supporting the object branding outcome or strategy.
remarks: Treats 'brand identity' in text as closely aligned with 'brand visual identity' entity.
Treats 'brand identity' in text as closely aligned with 'brand visual identity' entity.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: A distinctive color scheme contributes to creating a strong brand presence.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject positively contributes to, supports, or enhances the strength, likelihood, or quality of the object outcome.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject positively supports, shapes, or enhances the likelihood or quality of the object branding outcome or strategic result.
args.justification: All three relations express the same positive, supportive causal effect of a branding element (e.g., color usage or color scheme) on a branding outcome (e.g., strategy, visual identity, brand presence). They already share the canonical_rel_name 'contributes_to' and rel_cls_group 'CAUSALITY' but have slightly divergent canonical_rel_desc wordings and two different, overly specific rel_cls labels ('brand_element_function_relation' vs 'branding_effect_relation'). Normalizing to a unified canonical_rel_desc and a single, more general class 'branding_impact_relation' improves consistency and reuse in the schema.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject positively supports, shapes, or enhances the likelihood or quality of the object branding outcome or strategic result.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations express the same positive, supportive causal effect of a branding element (e.g., color usage or color scheme) on a branding outcome (e.g., strategy, visual identity, brand presence). They already share the canonical_rel_name 'contributes_to' and rel_cls_group 'CAUSALITY' but have slightly divergent canonical_rel_desc wordings and two different, overly specific rel_cls labels ('brand_element_function_relation' vs 'branding_effect_relation'). Normalizing to a unified canonical_rel_desc and a single, more general class 'branding_impact_relation' improves consistency and reuse in the schema.
